Reviews.Title: “One night only”
Reviews.Author: Tincrystal
Reviews.Content: Great location and relatively well priced for London but ridiculously cramped and hard to manouvre around with luggage. You'll need to be super fit to climb the steep stairs with your bags, so I suggest you pack light. Ok for one night stay whilst visiting the city but I would avoid it if you plan to spend a couple of days sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “It's means small”
Reviews.Author: fernandeskiko
Reviews.Content: Ok, the location is good, close to Victoria station... But if you are not in a good shape, forget it. The luggage must leave outside the bedroom. To get into your bedroom, you gonna have to climb the bed first. The breakfast is downstairs, a claustrofobic place, no windows, very small , few and squeezy tables. So if you really have to stay there take a breath before.

Reviews.Title: “Classic budget in an expensive town”
Reviews.Author: Monophoto
Reviews.Content: The Classic Hotel is a budget hotel in a very expensive town. The rooms are small (often tiny), but it is very clean, it offers free wifi (ask t the desk for the ssid and password), a complementary breakfast, and it is very convenient to transportation. The staff are friendly and attentive. The hotel is in Sussex Gardens, about five minutes away from the Paddington Rail station and halfway between both the Paddington and Edgeware Road undergound stations. That makes it easy to get to and from Heathrow, and also provides easy access to sightseeing spots in London. Hint: Paddington is probably preferable to Edgeware Road for Underground access - the walk involves crossing fewer high-speed streets and station access is via an escalator rather than lifts. The hotel itself appears to have been recently refurbished - the guest rooms are clean and nicely fitted out. They are small (it is London), and are intended mainly for sleeping. If you want to sit and read, find a pub nearby. Bathrooms are very small, but very nicely fitted out. Plenty of hot water. The Classic is a bit spendy, but probably not out of line for London.

Reviews.Title: “A bed for the night”
Reviews.Author: R0P0
Reviews.Content: To review this hotel as anything other than a bed for the night would be wrong as that is all we booked and used it for. A group of my self and 4 friends decided to go to London for a shopping/theatre trip and booked this hotel based on price, location and the option of a parking space. We had a family room for 4 (3 of us slept there and that was cosy!) and a double room which was much nicer ascetically. The family room had very dark, peeling wall paper and the two single beds had less than half a metre between them, the double bed was fine. The TV was great, really big but mounted on the wall above one of the single beds, so the person in that bed had to bunk with someone else to watch our morning dose of Jeremy Kyle. The shower in the family room was scalding hot, and there was no lock on the door, though it looked as if the bathroom had been recently and nicely renovated. We were given a kettle in the room, but with only two tea bags, no milk and a limited supply of sugar. The people in reception were happy to provide more and gave us a pint glass full of milk (??) and some more tea bags. The double room had the opposite problem with a luke warm shower, and they too had to request more tea bags. Our rooms were on the top floor which was 7 smallish flights of stairs – thank god for the spongy carpet! Saying that, my bed was actually very comfortable and I had a very good nights sleep. The hotel is in a very busy area and traffic sounds start early in the morning, this went un-noticed by myself as I am used to city areas, but it did bother some of my ‘village life’ companions. Breakfast was served until 9.30 in the teeny tiny dining room which had about 4 or 5 tables squashed together as tightly as possible. There was no option of a cooked breakfast, just toast, some shell on eggs floating in luke warm water and some cold (yep COLD) baked beans that may have been warmed at some point when breakfast was first put out at 7am! There were some tiny ‘croissant’ type things, to call them croissants would not be fair. There was a bowl with a few token plums and an apple, and some yogurts, but we just ate what we could face and then left quickly. We had to pay £10 for a parking space, which initially there were none of until one of the workers at the hotel moved his car, then it was extremely difficult to squeeze the car in without hitting any pillars. But we got there in the end and didn’t have to move the car until we left the following day. The good thing about this hotel was it’s location, a five minute walk from Paddington tube station, which was perfect for the Bakerloo line which took us to Oxford Street shopping and Charing cross station where we saw the Legally Blonde Musical at the Savoy Theatre. If you are going to a gig in Hyde Park, or a Musical in the west end the Classic Hotel is OK as a bed for the night, but if you are expecting something more, then this probably isn’t the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but dishonest !”
Reviews.Author: jiangar
Reviews.Content: Booked tonight and paid. When checking in, the staff said the first night was full and sold me to another hotel and check in again next day.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and value”
Reviews.Author: HilaryB1
Reviews.Content: Found staff courteous and very helpful - we were able to leave baggage both at the start and end of our break. Cost was reasonable for location. We had family room for a reduced price as only the 2 of us staying. Room had plenty of space and beds were clean, beds were firm (we like them this way) and we slept soundly. Although only 5min walk from Lancaster gate tube (and Barclay bike) station by Hyde Park the road traffic was low. 10 - 15min walk to top of Oxford street. Breakfast was continental with 3 types of cereal, 2 types of juices, beans, hard boiled eggs, toast, jams etc and fresh fruit - very good given some of the reviews i've seen at this hotel price point. This was all served in a basement dining area - also very clean. The hotel web site shows exactly what there is. If your looking for a reasonable priced hotel in London, clean with a good breakfast and ideal location you would have to go a long way to better this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bondeo
Reviews.Content: There are alot of factors to a great hotel stay - price, location, etc; and most importantly, your expectations of the hotel before your arrival. Overall I had a great stay considering the above factors. I managed to get a fantastic price which we will not see again for some time since the Olympics is coming up. Location - perfect via Heathrow Connect (around 8 quid compared to the Express at 18 quid, and only 13 mins faster). Advisable to take a taxi from the Paddington station if you have tons of luggages. Plenty of eateries/shopping around the area too. Bathroom was newly renovated; tiny but ok for one; but did not liked the low low pressure of the shower. The breakfast was simple and it wasnt bad for me; small dining area but it wasnt packed when I got there. Considering the price I got and helpful staff, I shall return. Be wary there are no lifts here so there may be difficulties moving a huge luggage (but great views from the top floor).

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but good value for money for double room”
Reviews.Author: dadinjo
Reviews.Content: Nothing special but good value for money for double room, renewed bathrooms - very nice and the only reason why we booked this hotel, rooms are very small but it is like elswhere, there is no much space for your things, there is wireless although signal is not so strong in the room, very good mattress in bed - if you like hard one...we were sleeping like babies, breakfast could be changed from time to time - always the same, staff is friendly, you get new towels every day and room is cleaned up also. Overall, nice stay...recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfortable and easy to access to Tube.”
Reviews.Author: Vod1980
Reviews.Content: Our family quad room was clean and comfortable and large enough for me, my partner and our 13 year old son. Comfy beds with memory foam mattresses, newly refurbished shower room finished to a high standard. Free broadband, large flat screen TV in room and kettle with tea/coffee etc. Plenty of drawer and wardrobe space to store our luggage. Beds made and clean towels and new toiletries provided every morning by housekeepers. The dining room is small but you get a good breakfast of toast and cereal, hot drinks and boiled eggs (??!!!), manager let us take a tray to the room for breakfast in bed which was good of him as there were people moaning about queuing for a table. I think this is a good value, clean hotel and we would deffo stay there again for a short break in London.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value”
Reviews.Author: hypnotized
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom were newly refurbished and very nice. We had enough space (dressers and wardrobe) to but our things away. The receptionist was always smiling and very friendly. After check-out he allowed us to leave our bags there for a day. Breakfast was OK. Room was little but we never had space problems. There was always place to sit. There could have been maybe a little more choice, but it wasn't a problem. Rooms were cleaned every day, so it was very clean. The only minus was the space between two doors where there was a wardrobe (in our room). There was no lighting and no space, it was very annoying. Also they should change windows and doors, the doors dind't seem very safe, but there was nothing to fear, beacause the hotel was safe itself. The view from the window wasn't good either, but it's nothing to complain about. Free wi-fi was great and we had a kettle in our room.. But not a hair-dryer as promised. I would definetely stay there again! :) Good value for money and excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “brand new”
Reviews.Author: Marinacourt
Reviews.Content: This is a newly refurbish hotel, so everything down to the toilet are new and great, If they provide a table and an electric kettle it would be prefect. .

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: themipaul
Reviews.Content: very good and clean cosy clean brand new,breakfast very good,always hot water

Reviews.Title: “Not bad i suppose”
Reviews.Author: A_Foley_Cork
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 11am having arrived in London early on the morning. The guy at reception told us that we couldn't check in until 1pm and advised us to come back at around 1.15pm as the rooms needed to be cleaned. I wasn't too happy but to be fair this was mentioned on our booking form. When we arrived back at 1pm he said we would be waiting about 20 mins so we waited. By 1.30pm our rooms still weren't ready and he informed us that we'd have to wait another 20 mins. Eventually at around 1.50pm one of our rooms was ready but we were told that the other room would not be ready for another 15 mins. Slightly annoyed at this we said we would wait together in the one room and wait for the other to be ready before going into the city. At 2.30 pm we still had heard nothing from reception and when i went down to check what was happening the original guy was gone and the new guy said he new nothing about a second room being got ready for us. After he checked that we were who said we were he said the room wouldn't be ready for another 30 mins which would have meant after 3pm. Very pissed off at this stage we decided to head off into London and get our room that evening after we returned. The rooms were small but not at all uncomfortable. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom although quite small was clean. The shower was fine for us and my two teenage daughters had no problem with it. The dining room was quite small with maximum seating for around 16 - 18 people. Breakfast was fine with a choice of cereals plus fresh toast. Orange juice and apple juice. Plenty of fruit and tea, coffee and hot chocolate. There was no fried breakfast but that didn't bother us at all. As a budget hotel this is fine and the location is ideal for easy access to London City. Marble Arch is only 15 mins walk from here. Paddington Station is only 10 mins as is Lancaster Gate tube station which has a direct line to Liverpool Street Train station. If your looking for somewhere reasonable, comfortable and close to the city this is fine for a place to put your head down after a day in the city. I would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: TheNoop123
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small, but so was the price, excellent location, new bathrooms, good breakfast, friendly helpfull professional staff, I shall go again, and again, it was for us better than expected

Reviews.Title: “I am struggling to believe the last two reviews.....”
Reviews.Author: tcwhk
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel by default. We had booked the sister hotel ABC Hyde Park on arrival we were told they only had one room for one member of our party and the rest of us would have to stay at the Classic Hotel. We were given a family room....one double bed and two singles. No space at all between the beds, clean bed linen but everything else was horrendous. Dangerous wiring, tape holding wires together. One glass between the four of us, two tea cups, one spoon. Bathroom was disgusting, I shower at least once a day but could not bring myself to use the shower, mould and orange stained shower curtain made me feel sick! We were told to go across to the ABC Hotel for breakfast this was the most basic breakfast you could expect. Admittedly we were given a discount for moving hotels but it still spoilt what was otherwise a lovely weekend. Be very careful when you book either the ABC or Classic Hotels in Hyde Park neither are anywhere near their description on the booking websites. You have been warned......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: jankph
Reviews.Content: Me and wife were in London for a short trip only, two nights, so we needed somewhere cheap but central, i.e. easy access to shops and sights and easy for getting to and from the airport without changing trains or underground. Having read the previous reviews - after I had booked, of course - I was not expecting anything particularly great, but since I read that the hotel was under renovation, my hope was that by the time I got there, the renovation (of my room at least) would be done. When we got there, we were told that they were doing some plumbing in our room, so we had to spend the first night at an hotel across the street, the ABC Hyde Park Hotel, see my review of that hotel for our first night. As we checked in the next day we were delighted to see that our room (#6) had just been fully refurbished, bathroom included. It was at the back and quiet, perfect for us. Well, almost perfect, as the backyard was used by smoking guests from neighboring hotels, which meant that we had to shut our windows every now and then. The bed was nice, but the room was relatively small and lacked a desk for writing/laptop. What was most disturbing was a rather loud dripping sound that seemed to come from the bathroom upstairs, like a shower head dripping into a bathtub. Internet is free, that's a bonus. Staff is friendly and helpful. Other travelers have complained about the minuscule breakfast room, and I can attest to that. You may have to queue before you get a seat. The location is excellent, just a short 5-minute walk from Paddington, and also within walking distance (30 mins) from Oxford Street. If I go to London again, this place will definitely be the shortlist of hotels I will consider.

Reviews.Title: “oh my god, don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: laurencrcornwall
Reviews.Content: Upon entering, they were renovating and building materials were everywhere. The place seemed half built. The room had been recently renovated and was lovely (although a hole in the wall next to a power socket was worrying). There was no signage up for fire escape routes and we were given a downstairs room with a barred window and no escape route. I asked the attendant who showed me a half blocked corridor ending in a door that stuck (not a proper push bar type)- this must be a breach of health and safety? We had no choice but to stay as it was late. we left our luggage their for the day as our room wasn't ready and were advised not to leave anything valuable in the cases. My wife left jewellery in one and we found it gone on our return home (although it may have been taken from our hotel in Greece-an empty jewellery box!). we were told our luggage would be taken to our room and when we got back late, it wasn't. Next morning another guest was complaining he had missed breakfast as he had been told the wrong time. The breakfast room was covered in sheets due to the work being done. We skipped breakfast and got out of there as soon as possible. I wish i read the other reviews first- other guests arriving looked shocked as we did and being English, didn't complain- don't do it!

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at this hotel again...”
Reviews.Author: sussie_65
Reviews.Content: Called the day before to let them know when we were suppose to arrive at their hotel. When we arrived there was a renovation going on...dust everywhere and the receptionist was bleeding when taking care of us..we checked in and then we had to wait out on the street for more than 30 minutes to get our room... Breakfast OK, but the room where they served breakfast was so small that if you weren't an early bird you had to "line up" outside to get a place to sit. To sum up it all...you get what you pay for.....

Reviews.Title: “Dont even give it a thought.”
Reviews.Author: juneybabes
Reviews.Content: Went with my sister and niece .Expected a family room,got a very cramped shabby dull room.Toilet smelly and stained,lamp was unsafe ,very hard bed and couldn,t turn radiater down no knob.No sleep because of noise from other room nearly all night .Continental brekfast very poor.Very somber shabby dull hotel glad it was only one night.Faulty towers would be a step up.Only good thing was the location,short walk from paddington station and hyde park. Dont waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: londonlotus
Reviews.Content: Classic Hotel............ Service was good. All staff polite and helpful. The room as the rest of the hotel was dated. The wallpaper was old and dirty. There were places were it was pealing off the walls. Our bedspread was old and stained. The TV was teeny tiny and the quality of the pictures was terrible. All but one channel (out of four) was blurry. The in built DVD player didn't work and almost trapped our DVD and held it hostage for quite a while. The floorboards are so creaky that if anyone walked in the room above us, it felt like they were right in the room with us. Poor sound insulation between rooms. Granted you don't pay much for having stayed in London...... but I have stayed in hotels in the same location and for cheaper and they all looked better than this place. The location is good, breakfast okay. On both days, the glasses were not clean and the continental breakfast was toast, cold beans and boiled eggs The breakfast was okay though. I would recommend you pay the extra Â£20 per night a better hotel where you can really relax and enjoy your stay in London

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't put my dog in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Timlo
Reviews.Content: It was disgusting. Anyone who says otherwise must have very low expectations. We made a booking through Laterooms.com on the 5th June to stay two nights at the ABC Hyde Park. Great website and recently refurbished. Imagine our surprise when we arrived to check in and were told the hotel was full with other guests and we would be put up in the Classic further down the road instead. We are both 70 and didn't feel we could go and look elsewhere for a hotel so had no option but to agree to this. The first room we were offered was totally unacceptable, it was not clean, was in dire need of decoration and tiny. The windows were covered in birds mess, there was a crack right across the shower tray and the toilet was stained. We asked to be moved and were then given a room 57 stairs up. Not much better decoration wise but a bit cleaner. All a far cry from what we were led to believe when we made our booking. Ignore any reviews that say otherwise about this hotel, it is dreadful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable - Basic”
Reviews.Author: Barnacle_Bill1
Reviews.Content: Very good - for what you are paying. This is a clean, comfortable & very basic hotel. The location is good and it's convenient to train and tube travel. Rooms are small and there is no lift (elevator) so staying on the 4th floor is a chore. There must be either new owners or manager because while we booked it with some trepidation based on early reviews, it was not the nightmare some make it out to be.

Reviews.Title: “nice and comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: kromjong
Reviews.Content: we were a group of friends who styed at classic hotel the rooms were clean very helpful staff at the front desk breakfast was continental but good conserdering what other hotels near by give. theirs also wireless internet access at the hotel free of cost i would definently reccomend this place and next time if i have to come london for any purpose i will only stay at classic hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay when visiting London”
Reviews.Author: deguedez
Reviews.Content: Went to London for the weekend, with my girlfriend and a couple who are friend of ours. Our ages are between 22 and 24. The location is great. From Sussex Gardens you can walk to Kensington Gardens or Hyde Park and the tube station of Paddington is also near the hotel, providing access to Bakerloo, Circle and District lines, three of the most important lines in the Tube network for a turist. We had booked a double room, but when we got to the hotel, there was only a triple room available and we stayed in it, but we payed the price agreed on the online booking for the double room. The room was big and confortable, with a double bed and a single bed. It had a jar to boil water, tea, sugar, tea cups and a spoon. A mini-fridge was also available, wireless internet, TV with 5 english channels incluiding ITV and BBC. There was also a hair dryer and a closet. The bathroom was tiny and it was the only place with European plugs. The room had a heater that you couldn't turn off and at night it was very unpleasent, has the room got very hot (hat least for me). The breakfast was from 7.30am to 9am. You could have boiled eggs and beans (I think), toasts, cereals, milk, coffee and juices. The room was quite small for the number of people that were staying at the hotel. One morning I had to wait to get a table. The tables and the chairs are place in such way that you get very tight when you are sitted down and makes it impossible not to disturb the other people who are having their breakfast. By far the worst aspect of the hotel. The staff were friendly and they were very helpful for everything that we've asked for. In sum, I strongly recommend this hotel for anyone who is thinking on spending some time in London and is trying not to spent too much money on accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, central location”
Reviews.Author: BjornS
Reviews.Content: We're a family of four who stayed at the Classic Hotel this summer. The rooms were clean, but small - the staff very friendly. Central, close to Paddington. No luxury, but worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel is Really Real”
Reviews.Author: PeterJonson
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Classic Hotel Hotel. We booked by phone the day before and got a good price for two double and 1 triple rooms for a group meeting in London.The staff was very friendly and helpful (the young people at the desk nicer than the older ones). the room were clean, comfy, not too big but not that small either. There were tea and coffee making facilities but although the kettle was new it wasn't that clean. TV had 4 channels only but DVD facility.There was also a fan and two extra pillows in the closet. The traffic disturbed a little when the windows were open. The continental breakfast had muesli and corn flakes, tea/coffee+ juices. It gave as a good start for the day. Our flight left in the evening and we could leave our luggage at the reception for the day, which was lovely. It is a small walk to Bayswater and Lancaster Gate tube stations and otherwise in a good location to see London. You can walk to Oxford street or if you are tired you will find lots of shops and restaurants nearby All and all we were pleasently surprised by this classic hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: DHelm
Reviews.Content: The roomâ€™s wireless-internet reception was so bad I could not use it for work purposes. The claim to offer wireless internet in every room is not accurate. Also, there was a putrid smell coming from the toilet all night. I had to effect a seal around the toilet door in case the smell was, as I suspect it may have been, sewer gas. Value is about more than money. I have since found better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Recomend to stay for everyone to stay this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulauto
Reviews.Content: Full kitchen I loved my stay on 9th of May 2008, very friendly and personable staff, resonable prices, well worth the upgraded suite. This hotel has recently gone through some remodeling and the new features accent the building walls papers are not very well,but was great, nice clean rooms, comfortable beds and pillows, decent free breakfast, and steps to everything you'll need! Shopping, restaurants, entertainment & fitness. I would and DO recommend this hotel to everyone that travels! .Wolfgang Schulz

Reviews.Title: “Dont even think about it”
Reviews.Author: to_marky
Reviews.Content: We booked through a travel agent expecting to get a reasonable room at a reasonable rate. No one in their right mind would recommend this place if they had ever seen it. Rooms are the smallest we've experienced on our UK tour. The bathroom is so small you must walk sideways to get to the toilet (I'm not large!). On arrival at 3pm we had to wait for the room to be cleaned, waiting in a small hallway, resting on our suitcases. Do yourself a favor, spend a few more pounds and get a decent hotel. We've stayed at many Jury's Inn's and they are simple but in a whole better category. We could only afford this holiday once and we stuffed these 3 days up for 100 or 200 bucks. PS - Wireless internet in UK is ridiculously expensive, even in hotels. (and not available at all at Classic).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was the first time we made a hotel reservation via internet. We only saw the pictures from the hotel website and liked them. We arrived at the hotel at about noon, and what we experienced was unbelievable. First, we had to pay in advance for our three-night stay. As I did not have any experience with terms of payment in hotels, I thought this was a usual handling. We went upstairs in our room. We opened the door and where faced with a huge mouldy smudge. A short vieuw into the bathroom gave us a promt feeling that running away fast would be the best we could do. We went downstairs again to the "lobby". Our complaint about the room made the woman working there showing us another room, as awful as the first one. After that, we told her that we would not stay in that hotel any night, and we kindly asked her to retransfer the complete money to our account, which she refused. She told us that we had to pay the full amount for the first night and additionally the fees for the internet booking for all three nights. So, when retransfering the money, she kept approx. 100 Pounds. Speechless we left the hotel, feeling a little bit helpless and very angry, too.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is very nice hotel and everything in it is very much clean.I like it.when again i come to london i will stay here only in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “been there won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't be mislead by boutique looking pictures. I researched the internet for for weeks before I made my decision to stay here based on the pictures. What I got was a dirty room so small we could not walk around the bed. Hard to sleep at night as I felt buggy. Structurally unstable as the floor slanted. Thank goodness it was just one night.

HotelInfo.Name: Classic Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 92 Sussex Gardens | Hyde Park, London W2 1UH, England
